intro: Linaria incarnata var. cossoniana, commonly known as the pink toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces vibrant pink to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Linaria incarnata var. cossoniana is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, making it a resilient addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
